events.text: Figures. Called to the scene, but they won't even let me in the door. Blue uniforms and red tape everywhere. Well, they could keep me out, but they couldn't stop a free man from smoking.

I fumbled for a lighter. Wasn't wearing my usual coat today. While I patted my pockets, hunting for fire like a lost soul looking for the light of civilization, I heard a click followed by a familiar voice.
Smoking is bad for you, you know.
Not as bad for me as the owner of that voice. But I played it cool, and looked up slowly to see her face.

Branch Officer Olivia Barbara Anime. Trouble on two legs. But those weren't the only two things about her that were dangerous. That's right. Her badge and her mind. As women went, she was as sharp as a fine cheddar, and just as dangerous for your heart.
Never paid to owe a debt to a woman like that, but I took the light anyhow, because it made me look very cool.
Figures you're the one giving me a light then, eh Olivia?
I've always invited trouble. That's why I called you here.
Yeah?
I couldn't stand how much space her full name and title took up in the text box. Better do something about that.
I bet you heard already through the grapevine, John. You've got ears everywhere.
She was right. I knew about the murder already. No point playing dumb around a woman that smart.
Yung Dab is dead.

Maximilian Thoroughbred, local business tycoon and the premier gangster SoundCloud rapper of Las Borpas. Found dead in his own home. Cause of death? You can bet your bottom dollar it wasn't poor record sales.
I imagine your brother is all torn up about it. Kid loved his albums, last I remembered.
Jesse isn't a kid anymore, John. Besides, you can ask him yourself. He's inside, working the case.

That little anklebiter, Jesse Anime. All grown up and joined the LBPD, just like his sister. Difference was though, kid was dumber than an internet fight. Must have pulled more strings than the Las Borpas Symphony Orchestra to get him on the force.
She had a soft spot for her little brother. Can't say I felt the same. Kid was loud as hell.
Finish that thing John, and letâ€™s get inside. I've got work to do.
That makes two of us. I stubbed out my cigarette, and went inside.
